results.title: The Secretary

results.title: Transcribing. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Secretary”
Following through a typical series of transcribing assignments, we learn about the placing of work materials to avoid waste motion; establishing priorities so that rush items get out first; and typing techniques for faster, neater letters. Basic letter forms and procedures for transcribing from a dictating machine.

results.title: The Secretary: taking dictation. - [2nd ed.]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Secretary”
A good secretary has the proper materials organised to respond quickly to the boss’s call. She knows correct posture, how to indicate special instructions, when to interrupt and when not, how to “key” dictation to letters being answered, and other routine procedures. Less often, she may record phone conversations or take the minutes of a meeting.

results.title: A Normal day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Secretary”.
Following through a normal day in an office we learn about typical secretarial responsibilities such as making appointments, greeting visitors, processing incoming mail, supervising files, organising a business trip, taking dictation, and transcribing. Emphasises the personal qualities of self direction, tact, willingness to learn, judgment and enthusiasm needed to be a successful secretary.

results.title: Whether to tell the truth
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan, Sam Spiegel, Learning Corporation of America and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Specially edited from “On the Waterfront”, produced by Sam Spiegel, directed by Elia Kazan, this film explores the theme of conscience and conflicting loyalties. It tells of a young man who painfully gains a sense of himself and of his duty to society at the cost of losing his friends and a familiar way of life. As a dock worker, Terry Malloy is bribed by his bosses to suppress information about the murder of a co-worker in which he had inadvertently taken part. Influenced by the parish priest and his own conscience he makes testimony and is left an outcast by his fellow workers. Based on the novel by Budd Schulberg. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: When parents grow old: extract from I never sang for
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Cates, Columbia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Edited from the motion picture ‘I never sang for my Father” starring Gene Hackman and Melvyn Douglas, this tells the story of a young man who must decide betweeb caring for his elderly wodowed father and marriage. The themes of responisibility to the aged, fear of growing old, and society’s treatment of the elderly are explored.

results.title: Violence: just for fun
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Uses extracts from the feature film “Barabbas” (produced by Dino de Laurentiis, directed by Richard Fleischer) to explore the theme of finding excitement and entertainment in the spectacle of violence - in this case, gladiators killing each other in battle. Easily accepting violence as an enjoyable aspect of ‘civilised life’, the Romans applaud the destruction of human lives and show no mercy to those defeated in combat. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Trouble with the law
results.brief_description:
Episode of series “Searching for values: a film anthology”
Edited from the feature film ‘Pursuit of happiness’, this extract shows how the legal process and justice are not always synonymous. A college student involved in a car accident rejects the standards by which the court finds him guilty and decides that justice has not been served.
Suitable for upper secondary level.
